attributes.action: Prioritise a green transformation in the COVID-19 economic recovery plan
attributes.background:
People want an urgent response to the climate emergency. We have now seen that rapid action in times of crisis is possible. 

Let’s use the COVID-19 pandemic as a turning point in climate action, combining economic recovery with sustainable climate policy. 

The time for action is now.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to step up their commitment to people and our environment.

The evidence is clear: implementing green policies is the best way to revive the economy and tackle climate change.

With all of our futures thrown into question by the pandemic, now is the best time to re-prioritise and build back better.

We’ve consolidated expert research on the most impactful measures to achieve a sustainable and thriving economy. 

Visit: Peoplesplan.org

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues in the UK.
attributes.background: We should ban disposable barbecues from sale in the UK. They are used incorrectly too often causing sometimes huge moorland fires.
attributes.additional_details:
Disposable barbecues used incorrectly are causing sometimes huge moorland fires all over the UK during the dry periods we've been having over the last few years using valuable emergency resource, damaging fragile environments and killing wildlife.
They are also ecologically unsound (best case is they go to landfill) and should be banned. 
They are dangerous when left unattended staying very hot for hours and contain a sharp metal mesh which can easily injure wildlufe or people coming across in unexpectedly.
Unfortunately people cannot be trusted to use these correctly as events through the years have shown.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Create journalism license
attributes.background: The current cycle does not work. The media needs reform and licensing.
attributes.additional_details: Currently the media is not in control of creating an environment of fact and news. there should be a license system that if the media lies then that outlet looses the right to broadcast information. All the journalist loses right to broadcast on any thing UK from abroad as well unless they apply of one.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300246

attributes.action: Ban wearing medical and nursing uniforms out of their working environment
attributes.background:
Medical and nursing uniforms are fomites for hospital acquired infections or viruses such as MRSA, Clostridium difficile and Covid-19.
They are PPE not just a fashion item. Therefore must stay in the clinical environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Uniforms are not only fomites for pathogens into clinical areas but also for transferring them from the hospital environment to the community.
This whole incident, has shown that the vulnerable locked down are at risk from transfer of bacteria and viruses from the community.
The number of deaths in care homes is massively disproportionate to elsewhere.
SO WHY ARE HOSPITAL AND CARE HOME STAFF WEARING UNIFORMS ROUTINELY TO /FROM WORK AND WHILE OUT SHOPPING IN SUPERMARKETS EVEN NOW ??

rejection.details:
The NHS are responsible for uniforms including providing guidance for washing and wearing uniforms outside of work, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about NHS England's guidance on uniforms and workwear here: https://www.england.nhs.uk/publication/uniforms-and-workwear-guidance-for-nhs-employers/

attributes.action: Make drive through take away outlets print the car registration on packaging
attributes.background: I would like the registered keeper of the vehicle to be responsible for ensuring that the takeaway packaging is disposed of in the correct way and not strewn across roads thrown on verges and into hedges etc
attributes.additional_details:
It would save costs for local authorities having to constantly pick up deliberately discarded packaging and improve the environment for everybody. 
If a meaningful fine was imposed on the owner of an offending vehicle maybe people would think twice about discarding their waste in an irresponsible way. This could easily be achieved using number plate recognition at the order point and running the packaging through an ink jet printer when the order is made up.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324517

attributes.additional_details: Zoo's are home to many endangered species of animal, bringing them to safe environments. They are protected from poachers, are given the appropriate habitat, and saved from starvation. These zoo's also enable the breeding of these animals, enhancing on population numbers. Not just for the animals, but for humans this provides a broad range of necessities. They provide the enrichment and a hobby needed for mental health. The natural history of our planet. Education, for all ages. Jobs for many

attributes.action: Coronavirus: make joggers wear face masks and stop families going out in groups
attributes.background:
Tell joggers they must wear face masks as too many don’t respect social distancing and are huffing and puffing or spitting near people. 

Stop families going out in groups of more than 2. Kids don’t do social distancing, they bump into anyone, climb over everything and take up whole foot paths.
attributes.additional_details: Because it’s not good hygiene in this environment for joggers to be heavy breathing around people in such close proximity. It’s also not good for kids on scooters and bikes and families taking up whole foot paths when they could easily go out as two people. Not whole families and dogs. Lockdown isn’t a family day out to the park.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the current guidance about what activities individuals and households can undertake outside of their household, but its not clear whether you are requesting the Government to change its guidance on social distancing, or amend regulations on what constitutes on offence under the Coronavirus Act 2020, or both.

If you want the Government to change its guidance to advise members of the public to wear face masks when they are undertaking certain activities, or for households to only exercise in certain size groups, you could start a new petition requesting this. If you want the Government to make it an offence to engage in certain activities without wearing a face mask, or to leave the house in groups of a certain size, you could start a new petition requesting this.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make it mandatory to wear a face mask in public during Covid-19 Pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304397

attributes.action: Announce a future public inquiry into all aspects of the Coronavirus epidemic.
attributes.background: Appropriate minister to exercise powers under the Inquiry Act 2005 to announce now a future inquiry into the impact of Coronavirus epidemic on the UK and create a shadow Inquiry Team under a senior Judge as chair to commence gathering live data and evidence to inform the statutory inquiry’s work.
attributes.additional_details: In a fast moving disaster environment, crucial data and evidence may well be lost, including through the deaths of key personnel. A well planned and structured shadow inquiry team will be authorised to gather relevant data and evidence independently of government in preparation for a future inquiry into all aspects and arrangements, including governance, public health, economic, cultural and civic matters. The work will allow for a faster, better informed response to inform future policy making.

attributes.background: Pass legislation that provides for no trading on Sundays.
attributes.additional_details:

- the desire and benefits arising from more families spending more quality time together. There has been a huge amount of feedback, particularly, children of all ages stating this. 
- The environment, particularly, air quality has improved significantly during the lockdown. Some of that benefit would be retained as there would be significantly less traffic on the roads in a week, then there is presently. 
We have learnt during this crisis, ‘Society’ does exist and such a measure will encourage this.

attributes.background: I would really like the government to give a directive to the general public to stop lighting bonfires at this time of crisis. attributes.additional_details: Along with the general public many extremely vulnerable people are having to stay at home including people with lung desease. The NHS has sent a letter out stating these people need to stay indoors and only open windows. An open window, maybe a garden is the only sanctuary that the vulnerable have, unable to go for walks. Bonfires can make it impossible to go out in the garden and have a window open. As garden waste stoped, centres closed more people are starting to light bonfires every day.

attributes.action: Remove healthcare clinical placement students from sites until safe
attributes.background: Advise uni’s to pull students until the situation is more stable. Being transmittable before symptomatic places every other student at risk, particularly those more vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details: Universities look to the Government and regulatory bodies for guidance; however this has been minimal in this area. Students are feeling incredibly vulnerable and whilst this will be accepted once graduated- at the moment they are risking a lot with unnecessary travel and no payment. Many placement sites are over 1-2 hours from campus’s- meaning students are being forced to take public transport to and from a hospital environment- simply to return and potentially transmit to other students

attributes.action: Take action to save the UK chalk streams from over abstraction
attributes.background: To urgently debate this topic, to add latest evidence to POSTnote POST-PN-0546, and to promote action rapidly on the proposals contained within this note. The government must lead from the front and introduce policies to reverse the damage to our chalk streams which are under ever increasing threat.
attributes.additional_details: Decades of excessive water abstraction from chalk aquifers in the UK has caused undue stress on our groundwater supplies, directly resulting in the loss of invaluable chalk stream habitats. Worldwide we in the UK are guardians of the vast majority of these unique environments and we have failed totally to protect them. Springs that feed our chalk streams are drying up as water levels in underground substrates continue to fall and abstraction remains at unsustainable levels. Action is needed now.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban fireworks for public use
attributes.background: Ban fireworks. To be brought for personal use.
attributes.additional_details: They are set off most of the year not just on days. When meant to be. This can be very distressing to many. People with senor issues struggle immensely. Also family pets come extremely anxious. And wildlife. Not to mention the environment. Plastic left everywhere which is a choking hazard to animals.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616868

attributes.action: Adapt Water Protection Laws to what they were Pre-Brexit
attributes.background: In recent years, after Brexit, Water Pollution has massively increased within river systems within England, as they have repealed most of the Water Protection laws that were EU laws. In order to have a government that cares for the people, we need our water systems to be safe from pollutants.
attributes.additional_details: Water Pollution has been scientifically proven to have adverse and damaging effects on the natural local biodiversity of environments across river basins and a dramatic effect on human health for those residing in river basins which are affected by Water Pollution. With the government's help in reinstating European Union water protection laws, we can ensure that the British Public has access to clean and safe rivers without the risk of chemical, thermal and environmentally damaging pollution

rejection.details:
It is not the case that most EU laws relating to water have been repealed, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Keep retained EU environmental laws until equal or stronger UK laws introduced: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623839

attributes.action: Ban the breeding and selling of rabbits, parrots and exotic birds in pet shops
attributes.background: Ban breeding and selling of rabbits, parrots and other exotic birds or animals being sold in pet shops in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Rabbits and parrots are highly intelligent animals that don't do well in these environments. They aren't good children's pets which most people are purchasing for when going to a pet shop. Parrots can live for 90 years and need an experienced owner. Rabbits need a lot of care and large areas to roam they shouldn't be caged. All of this information we now know hence why still selling them in pet shops is wrong. Also most shop owners/workers have no animal care knowledge experience either.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see the breeding and selling of certain animals banned, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to cover as 'exotic animals'.

You could start a new petition explaining more clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: DO NOT delay ANY carbon-reduction commitments on the journey to Net Zero 2050
attributes.background: Delivering Net Zero CARBON EMISSIONS by 2050 is a tough target. Notwithstanding all other pressures, this is the highest priority for our Nation's wellbeing and prosperity. Pressing actions must be taken NOW and continue WITH URGENCY throughout 2022-2050 to comply with the Environment Law (Nov 2021)
attributes.additional_details:
Less than 0.2% of the electorate voted for Liz Truss as PM. We DO NOT TRUST her pledge to 'ensure opportunity and prosperity for all people and future generations' as she diverts wildly from the commitments that elected this government into office.
Specifically, any redirection of post-CAP Land Management Scheme (ELMS) financing, designated to consolidate a long-term vision to revitalise natural resources, our land base and our agronomy will be welcoming climate change catastrophy. What a legacy

rejection.details:
We understand you would like to see the Government fulfil it's commitments to the 2050 net zero target for carbon emissions and not delay, but the target is set out in law and the Government have not outlined any changes or delay to that year as the target.

You could start a new petition which explains clearly which specific actions you would like the Government to take to achieve the 2050 target.

We currently have the below petition open on a similar theme, which you might like to sign:

Bring forward the Net Zero emissions target to 2030
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616392

attributes.action: Stop DVLA forcing classic cars through full IVA for electric power conversions.
attributes.background:
DVLA has changed rules on converting classic cars to electric power, preventing these conversions, removing converted cars from the road, and insisting on an IVA and Q-plate for cars with necessary 'modifications' as small as holes drilled in the boot.
Classic cars can't pass an IVA, please stop it
attributes.additional_details:
The DVLA must clarify how and why their old rules are being applied to this new issue and justify the conflict with government policies like reducing emissions and saving the environment. 
Please ask how this rule disallows welding to reverse forbidden modifications like drilled 'holes' and so allow cars back on the road.
If they cannot do this, then they must write new specific codes and rules for retrospective electrification of cars and review recent cases like 96628439 and many others.

rejection.details: Petitions must ask for a clear action from the Government or Parliament. It's not clear if you want the Government to change the rules relating to modifying classic cars, or for the Government to publish an explanation for how these rules have changed. You could open petitions on both of these asks.

attributes.action: Shift subsidies and tax breaks from fossil fuels to renewable for a safer future
attributes.background: Gas and petroleum companies are economically supported through tax breaks and hidden subsidies, UK is reliant on external suppliers at detriment to our immediate and global environment. Shift support to UK based renewable energy production and storage to create a stable and safe supply.
attributes.additional_details:
Although the government claims to not support fossil fuel industry through subsidies it does so in ways that are hidden to consumers.

Britain currently supports the fossil fuel industry through tax breaks and subsidies for exploration and research and development.  It estimated this at around £10 billion a year.

Not only does Britain not have reserves to draw on making us vulnerable to monopoly leaders, continuing the use of these as energy is detrimental to our ever more fragile environment.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

End All Government Subsidies for Fossil Fuel Companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621583

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Invest in new nuclear and renewable generation to replace fossil fuels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621050

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030
67 signatures: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

attributes.action: Decarbonising defence
attributes.background: To make the Millitary more sustainable for the environment
attributes.additional_details: We want to let out less co2 emmisions so that we can live in a future that is clean.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about emissions associated with UK defence arrangements, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The Ministry of Defence has published a Climate Change and Sustainability Strategic Approach, which sets out the ambition, the principles and the methods needed for UK Defence to meet the challenge of climate change: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/ministry-of-defence-climate-change-and-sustainability-strategic-approach

If there are specific actions you want the UK Government to take to reduce emissions from UK defence arrangements you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Large Artificial Plants, Flowers and Grass
attributes.background:
The use and sales of artificial plants and grass is utterly unacceptable in 2022 - we need a ban
- Damages and contaminates the structure of the soil
- Manufacturing and delivery contributes to carbon emissions
- Plastic grass can’t or won’t be recycled
- They have no wildlife benefit whatsoever
attributes.additional_details: Think about the environmental impact of allowing the sale of artificial plants and grass. As a country we want to decrease carbon emissions but we are allowing the sale of these items?! I'm asking you to do a report on the impact to the environment and ban the sale of these goods.

rejection.details:
We understand you would like the sale of artificial grass, flowers and plants to be banned, but we're not sure whether you want this ban to apply to all artificial plants and flowers, or only those intended to be planted outdoors (where there might be any risk of 'damaging and contaminating the structure of the soil').

You may like to sign these petitions which call for similar actions: 

Introduce an "Ecological Damage Tax" on Astroturf Lawns / Artificial Grass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608295

Ban the sale and use of fake grass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617801

attributes.action: Stop the use of Sparx homework in UK schools.
attributes.background: Sparx creates a stressful environment for secondary school students to work in. We want Sparx work to be banned in all UK secondary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
1) It creates pressure and impacts the students mental health poorly 
2)It puts unnecessary stress onto students
3) You're not allowed to make mistakes on questions and you can't negative feedback if ypu cannot complete questions. For some students, this is extremely damaging to their mental health.
4)There are too many questions for students to complete, which can take up students evenings (and this can be their only time to get away from school stress)

rejection.details:
It's a matter for individual schools which homework and educational tools they use. Petitions must ask for an action that the Government or Parliament are responsible for.

You could start a petition asking the Government to review schools' usage of online educational tools (such as Sparx Maths).

attributes.action: Working from home by law.
attributes.background: I want the Government push by law Working from home scheme. Where is possible and force company and businesses, even the Government itself  to make this possible.
attributes.additional_details: Working from home will tackle cost of living crisis, will enhance family bond depopulate city centers and will decreased mayor traffic jam in rush hour and pollution. Workers will be in friendly environment productivity will increase.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure whether you want a requirement or a right to work from home, where possible. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Create safe dog leash laws in the UK
attributes.background:
Require ALL off leash dogs to be leashed before approaching on leash dogs - in all areas. 
Implicate safe and appropriate muzzle wearing for dogs of any breed and size if aggressive or reactive.
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and so many others have experienced dog attacks or off leash dogs approaching with no recall and those of which are aggressive and not friendly leaving owners to break up dog fights and attacks. 
Whilst we are either training our dogs, working on our rescue dogs reactivity or walking our old and unwell dog, off leash approaching can cause major setbacks, triggers and dangerous environments.
We want to create a safe and considerate environment and implicate appropriate laws for dog safety.

rejection.details:
We understand you want a requirement to be introduced that dogs have to be muzzled if they are "aggressive or reactive", however it's not clear how you want 'aggressive' or 'reactive' to be defined. There are already laws in place prohibiting the ownership of certain 'dangerous' breeds of dog. You can find out more about 'breed specific legislation' here: https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/CDP-2021-0111/CDP-2021-0111.pdf.

You could have a petition calling for muzzles to be required for certain breeds of dog, if that is something you'd like to see happen, so long as the petition was clear which breeds these would be, or how you wanted these breeds to be identified.

You might also like to sign this petition which calls for a related action:

'Require dogs to be kept on a lead at all times when in public': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599677

attributes.action: Designate public no-wi-fi zones to heal from our always-on society
attributes.background: Our petition asks our government to invest in no-wi-fi zones to combat the omnipresence of smartphones and the effect they’ve had over our spaces, health, and communities.
attributes.additional_details:
London has reached the point of hyper-connection; the wi-fi web has been sown throughout the city, and rare are public space where cellphones don’t get service. We’ve lost the right to be offline, and rarely do we see eye-to-eye anymore.

Our proposal is an opportunity re-establish the boundaries between the real and virtual world. It's a platform for expression, empowering people to use their diversity to create unique relationships with their environment and other human beings.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local wifi availability are a matter for individual businesses and local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: End Daylight Saving Time.
attributes.background: Ending Daylight Saving Time.
attributes.additional_details:
Some key reason but not limited to these:

Improve mental well-being due by reducing evening darkness.

Allow outdoor sports to continue on unlit parks and venues, which should lead to a higher uptake of exercise and improved fitness. 

Better for the environment due to lower electricity usage as people will be outside longer in the evenings or will not need to switch on house lights so early.

Allow the Scottish parliament to legislate which path they wish take.

(I’ve reached text limit)

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597436

attributes.action: Adopt a phased approach for removing entitlement to use rebated (red) diesel
attributes.background: Introduce an annual escalator on fuel duty. Viable alternatives are simply not available or reasonably accessible. As a fiscal measure an escalator would stimulate more research and development, time for implementation and provide market ready conditions, whilst preserving businesses
attributes.additional_details: Sectors relying on rebated fuel are critical to the UK economy, society and the environment. Construction, Waste and other sectors will be seriously impacted by the removal of entitlement and will face catastrophic consequences in terms of ability to trade and provide essential services. The landscape is exceptionally different now compared to when the hike was announced, with ongoing issues flowing from; Covid, Brexit, driver shortages, economic recovery, energy crisis and consumer inflation

rejection.details:
We currently have the below petition open on a similar topic which you might like to sign:

Delay removal of red diesel entitlement from the construction industry
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607637

attributes.action: Scrap plans to ban people without GCSE Maths/English from accessing studentloans
attributes.background: Scrap plans to ban people who don’t have GCSE Maths and/or English from accessing student loans. Do not implement exam grades as a factor for getting student loans.
attributes.additional_details: It’s essential that everybody has the chance to go to university. Some people don’t get these GCSEs because of the school they go to which might be in a poorer area. It’s completely unfair to block them from making the leap to uni just because of where they live. These tests don’t always test actual intelligence. Students must tick boxes and some of the brightest individuals struggle. That doesn’t mean they don’t deserve access to higher education in an environment that might suit them better.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609369

attributes.action: Lift visa requirements for Ukrainian citizens.
attributes.background: Ireland originally forced Ukrainian citizens to require visas in order to access the country but as a result of the conflict that is occurring right now, Ireland has lifted their visa requirement for Ukrainians to allow them to seek refuge in Ireland. We wish the United Kingdom would do the same.
attributes.additional_details: We know eventually countries like Poland who are accepting as many refugees as possible will struggle with handling with these many people and therefore the UK as a key world player and a close friend of Poland and many other Eastern European countries, should help our allies and together help the ever more Ukrainians escaping the dangerous environment they once called a safe home.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Allow Ukrainians with family in the UK to enter the UK without a visa: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609397

Offer fast track asylum to any Ukrainians displaced due to the invasion: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609382

Waive visa requirement for Ukrainian refugees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609530

Help Ukrainian refugees and create a safe path for them to get to the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609574

Grant Ukrainian citizens fleeing the war full rights to live and work in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609434

Draw up and implement a specific Ukrainian refugee strategy for the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609431

attributes.action: Re-nationalize the UK energy supply industry
attributes.background: Create a new state ownership framework to replace the current failing OFGEM regulated energy supply industry.
attributes.additional_details: Over the past five years more than 40 energy companies have failed. To say this is quite normal is ridiculous. It is clear that the current OFGEM regulated approach is not working. As a direct result millions of customers have crashed from one failed supplier to the next. Anxiety and stress caused to customers who have to pick up the bill with each failure is grossly unfair. In past decades although the industry was not competitive customers had a stable and well structured environment.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608056

attributes.action: The government must rescind emergency authorisation of neonicotinoid pesticides
attributes.background: George Eustace MP, Secretary of State for the Environment, cannot sanction deployment of neonicotinoid pesticides given the link between use of these extremely harmful chemicals and the dramatic decline in bee populations.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing the use of neonicotinoid pesticides anywhere in the UK is completely at odds with goverment aims to protect the environment and restore wildlife habitats. A red line must be drawn banning their use altogether, with no get-out clauses for emergency deployment.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606788

attributes.action: Make working from home mandatory or down to employee choice.
attributes.background: The government has lifted the working remotely policy in the wake of Boris Johnson’s embarrassment about ‘party gate’. It is not safe to work in offices etc; it is not safe to be crowded in an air cycled room. At least allow the employee to make their own choice.
attributes.additional_details: Working from home allows the employer and employee to keep themselves and their family safe. It decreases the stressful potential exposure of a commute, this in turn will benefit the environment. Working from home has been working for the last two years without issue for employees. Let us choose if we want to risk our lives for the sake of rent on an office building.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the safety of workers attending workplaces, but we're not sure if you want the Government to require home working where possible, reinstate guidance that people should work from home where possible, or do something else.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make working from home a legal right to help cut co2 emissions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600686

attributes.action: Include hybrid and/or remote work as standard clauses in employment contracts
attributes.background: Make hybrid and/or remote work clauses a standard option in all employment contracts.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that both employers and employees have benefitted from hybrid/ remote work during the pandemic. Better mental and physical health, more work efficiency, greater investment in local communities, infrastructure and property (including the ability to buy homes in more affordable locations) and benefits to the environment are just a few examples. Hybrid and/or remote work options in employment contracts would continue this process and more accurately reflect many people's wishes.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the content of employment contracts are a matter for individual employers, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make working from home a legal right to help cut co2 emissions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600686

We could accept a petition calling for different changes to rights to flexible working, but it would need to be clear what additional rights you wanted workers to have. You can read about existing rights relating to flexible working here: https://www.gov.uk/flexible-working

attributes.action: Cancel GCSE and A level summer exams because of omicron disruption.
attributes.background:
This year Students would like the government and the department for education to cancel all GCSE and A-Level exams for summer 2022 and to have this replaced with the predicted grades, that was successfully operated in the summer of 2021.
Instead of adjustments.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the lack of support from online learning during the closure of all schools in the UK , many students don't have the sufficient education to undertake these exams without severe psychological distress. In addition to this, the majority of education establishments in the UK didn't have the capable needs to supply education from a remote learning environment. The overall causality will be a huge amount of failing students whom will not be able to apply to university or find a proper career.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597282

attributes.action: Stop the metaverse
attributes.background: Encourage family time by reducing the use of technology in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: To prevent society from declining into an escapist, lonely environment, in which humanity will belittle God's work.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for deciding how people spend their time.

attributes.action: Improve the system for underage survivors of sexual assault and/or rape
attributes.background: The current system for victim support is incredibly stress filled and complicated. It is traumatic to have to repeat your story constantly just for certain agency's to believe you. Funding of tuition for survivors who leave school also adds to this stress. As well as the CAMHS system in general.
attributes.additional_details:
Overlook and fix the plans already in place. Forming a concrete protocol for when a child opens up about these events. Making sure they are in the best environment for learning, they are in a good mental state and make sure they are not having to repeat their story. 

This should be mandatory without a court ruling as a large quantity of cases are either dismissed or add to distress in the mind of the child. None of these rulings would act as punishment to the rapist as it does not concern them.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce reforms to better support victims of sexual assault and domestic abuse: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598009

Fund counselling for all adolescent victims of sexual abuse: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600660

Ensure the police offer victim support within 24 hours: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588113

If you want the Government to do something different to the above petition, you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Members of Parliament and Piers (MPs) to have compulsory vaccinations.
attributes.background:
Compulsory vaccination program be roled out for all MPs, Peirs and their employees.
How can we be sure members of the houses are doing all they can to mitigate the chances of spreading this deadly disease?
Social care and NHS workers require a vaccination to work. Why are MPs any different?
attributes.additional_details: MPs should consider themselves frontline workers. They often work in crowded environments with the public in public buildings, along sided their private endeavours. Encourage those that have not yet had the vaccine to come forward and volunteer for this vaccination trail. Show the doubters there is nothing to fear by having compulsory vaccinations for MPs. It is a vital component for them to be able to carry out their duties safely, for themselves and those they come in to contact with.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598503

attributes.action: Make websites prominently display where their products are made.
attributes.background:
Make it a legal requirement for:

- companies selling physical goods to state on their website where each product is made, the nation in which the company selling those goods is based, where the raw materials came from to make the goods & most importantly make this info as prominent as the price.
attributes.additional_details:
Most goods are now purchased at speed from the internet. Due to this change we believe less thought is given to the impact these purchases might have on the environment due to their origin not being known or easily accessible.

This additional information will also make the provenance of products more transparent, so that consumers can make an informed choice on whether they wish to purchase goods or products made in countries that do not respect basic human rights and freedoms.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595126

attributes.action: Make Seaweed Packaging mandatory as a direct replacement for plastic.
attributes.background: To make it law that companies have to use seaweed based packaging as a direct replacement for plastic in their business where possible This will co-ordinate a countrywide response and lead the global conversation that we need to act now on this.Manufacturers have an environmental responsibility too.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic packaging used in a variety of consumer goods is causing a worldwide choking of our oceans and rivers. If we can stop this at source, at the manufacturing stage before the consumer buys the product, we will drastically reduce the impact on our environment, while balancing the needs of our economy. Seaweed degrades naturally, is as strong a plastic and where it is possible to replace plastic we all need to do it. Time is running out for us to change our ways. You can unify these efforts

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament is directly responsible for. Decisions about what material to use to replace plastic is a matter for individual companies, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban all single-use plastic:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586547

Ban the use of virgin plastics in all packaging sold in the UK before 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

Ban the use of plastic food packaging: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595495

attributes.action: Amend environment bill to stop sewage being pumped into rivers and seas
attributes.background: Make an amendment to the environment bill to regulate the level of treatment required of sewage and prevent it simply being pumped into our rivers and seas. If this requires support from the government for water companies put this in place.
attributes.additional_details: Britains rivers and seas and marine life are being threatened by the introduction of untreated sewage. This needs to be regulated and water companies required to treat and dispose of sewage in a responsible way. Sewage is entering the food chain!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: Prevent strike action from disrupting public services like rubbish collection
attributes.background: It is important for workers to have the right to protest if they are not satisfied with their working conditions, however this cannot interrupt basic services such as rubbish collection that we pay council tax for as residents.
attributes.additional_details: Local councils should have the option to hire private services to collect rubbish if normal collection services are interrupted by strike action. Allowing rubbish to pile up on our streets and in our gardens should never be allowed to happen - It creates very serious health issues for a large portion of the population, it's bad for the environment (Wildlife can easily access the rubbish) and recycling is not necessarily disposed of properly, to name a few serious problems this creates.

rejection.details: Councils are already able to hire private services and decisions around rubbish collection lie with councils, rather than the Government. You might want to start a petition asking the Government to provide additional funding to support Councils to hire alternative private services.
